intro: Buceragenia ruellioides, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered with fine hairs. Buceragenia ruellioides is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
